Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders

Interface DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser

All Known Subinterfaces:
DefaultPersonInitialiser
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultModelBuilder
public interface DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser
Default initialiser for the Markov in‑host model.

This interface supplies a focussed default implementation that converts a MarkovStateModel configuration and execution parameters into an InHostMarkovState instance. The implementation samples durations and produces per‑day transition probabilities used by the Markov in‑host state machine.

Role in composition: the method defined here is intended to be used by DefaultPersonInitialiser and is composed into DefaultModelBuilder. In the default composition the model builder delegates to this interface's default method via DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser.super.initialiseInHostModel(...). This separation keeps in‑host specific logic isolated and easily replaceable.

Demographic adjustment: the implementation consults the optional PersonDemographic and applies demographic adjustments using ReflectionUtils.modify(X, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.PartialDemographicAdjustment, io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic) before sampling from the configuration. This allows age or group specific variation in incubation and symptom timings via the configured DemographicAdjustment.Markov.

Extension guidance: implementers that need different Markov initial behaviour should replace this interface or subclass the model builder and override the delegation point. Keep the initialiser responsible only for creating the initial immutable in‑host state; avoid performing heavy IO here unless managed by the calling builder.

Author:
Rob Challen

    Create an InHostMarkovState from a Markov configuration.

  • Method Details

    • initialiseInHostModel

      default InHostMarkovState initialiseInHostModel(MarkovStateModel configuration, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig, Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time)
      Create an InHostMarkovState from a Markov configuration.

      The default implementation applies demographic adjustments (if a PersonDemographic is present), samples distributional durations and computes mean rates and per‑day probabilities using the Conversions helpers. The returned state initialises the internal state machine transition probabilities.

      Parameters:
      configuration - the Markov in‑host configuration (possibly adjusted)
      execConfig - the execution configuration providing population rates
      person - optional person demographic used for demographic adjustment
      rng - sampler used for stochastic sampling
      time - current simulation time used for time stamped state
      Returns:
      an initial InHostMarkovState
